header.title: MONEY AND LOVE RITUALS
header.category: Western Esotericism, Practical Folk Magic, Operative Magic

central_thesis: Magick serves as an enhancement to one's life, rather than a creator ex nihilo, requiring a balanced combination of ritualistic practice (utilizing candles, oils, herbs, and powders) with consistent mundane effort and a clear, defined goal to manifest desired outcomes in areas such as love, money, and personal protection.

structure_content.summary: Magick enhances life, providing opportunities rather than creating from nothing. Success in rituals for wealth and love requires concurrent mundane effort and a balanced approach. Practitioners must clearly define their goals (e.g., money vs. success, sex vs. lasting love) as different rituals and tools are required.

structure_content.chapter_title: SIMPLE RITUALS FOR LOVE AND MONEY
structure_content.summary: Presents a basic altar setup for attraction rituals: two white candles (NUMBER ONE) and one central colored candle (TWO). The color of candle TWO and the associated oils/incense change based on the goal (e.g., Red/Pink for love, Green/Gold for money). Introduces the use of powders placed in a 'V' shape pointing towards the practitioner to project energy. Talismans and Tarot cards are suggested as supplementary tools.

Emphasizes the necessity of continuous protection rituals against envy and negative energies, serving as 'insurance' for relationships and finances. A ritual setup involves two white candles (NUMBER ONE, with Van Van oil), a master candle (TWO, color varies by area to protect, e.g., Red/Pink for love, Green/Gold for money), and a specific protection candle (THREE, Blue or Purple, with Protection Oil). A circle of Fiery Wall of Protection powder is drawn around candle THREE to seal energies. Charm bags and talismans are recommended for external protection.

structure_content.chapter_title: THE USE OF INCENSE IN RITUAL
structure_content.summary: Incense is presented as a powerful tool for rituals, general protection, and banishing negative energies. It helps maintain focus on the ritual's goal and cleanses spaces (home, automobile, yard). The quality of incense is stressed, with specific instructions for burning on charcoal discs and avoiding chemical-laden varieties.

Outlines a sex/lust attraction ritual using white candles (Van Van oil + Patchouli), a red candle (TWO, with Fire Of Passion or Lust/Sex oils), and a brown or purple candle (THREE, with a different Lust/Sex oil) to target lower chakras or amplify force. The target's name is carved on candle TWO. Rituals are ideally performed during Venus or Mars planetary hours. Caution is advised regarding sexual contact and general aura cleanliness. Charm bags or dolls are suggested.

Describes a money drawing ritual using the same basic attraction setup. Candle TWO is green (Money Drawing, Fast Luck, or Lucky Lady oil), and candle THREE is brown (Crown Of Success oil). Notes that money and sex rituals yield fast but temporary results, requiring constant reapplication. Warns about the 'non-selectivity' of these powerful drawing rituals. Charm bags or dolls are recommended for Money Drawing.

structure_content.chapter_title: ENHANCE THE ROMANCE IN YOUR RELATIONSHIP
structure_content.summary: Offers simpler methods like anointing candles with Love oils or burning Love Incense during the hour of Venus. Suggests sprinkling love powders in bed sheets. For a full-scale ritual, white candles (Van Van oil) and a pink candle (TWO, with milder Love oils) are used, avoiding overly sexual formulas. Culinary herbs are listed as love enhancers, and specific colored candles (Red for sex, Blue for conflict, Yellow for depression) with corresponding oils (e.g., JOY oil) are advised for addressing particular relationship issues.

Introduces candle proximity as an operative technique where candles are moved closer daily for attraction or farther apart for separation, symbolizing the desired outcome. A Love Attraction ritual involves male and female figure candles (Red or Pink, with specific attraction oils) initially placed apart and moved closer over several days. A variation for money drawing includes a fourth candle representing the practitioner.

Details a ritual for protecting a relationship from external interference. It uses white candles (NUMBER ONE, with No 20 Love Oil), a purple candle (TWO, with Commanding or Bend Over oil) representing the troublemaker (carved name), and a blue candle (THREE, with Fiery Wall of Protection or Protection oil) for the mate/lover (carved name). A circle of Fiery Wall of Protection powder is drawn around candle THREE. Bay leaves can also be used. For serious problems, Snuff Powder or Devil's Snuff Powder is suggested to be sprinkled into the flame of the purple candle.

structure_content.chapter_title: HOW TO DEAL WITH AN UNWANTED LOVER
structure_content.summary: Suggests powders like Get Away, Lost and Away, Quitting, and Yo Yo Powder for general banishing (sprinkled across doorways or on the person). A major ritual setup involves white candles (Van Van), a black figure candle (TWO, with Love Breaker oil) for the unwanted lover, a white figure candle (THREE, with Uncrossing or Fiery Wall of Protection oil) for the practitioner, and a purple candle (FOUR, with Commanding or Obeah oil), with Separation powder down the center of the altar. This 7-day ritual is best started before the New Moon. An alternative 'cucumber freezer spell' is also described for control.

structure_content.chapter_title: TO BRING BACK A LOST LOVE
structure_content.summary: Acknowledges the difficulty of bringing back lost love, often suggesting finding a new partner. Describes a ritual involving crushing Dragon's Blood Reed, writing the loved one's name SEVEN times on parchment with Dove's Blood Ink, placing the herb in the parchment, burning it on charcoal, and then observing 24 hours of strict silence.

structure_content.chapter_title: HE/SHE WON'T MARRY ME (WON'T ASK THE QUESTION)
structure_content.summary: Addresses commitment issues. A red figure candle (representing the person, carved name, anointed with Wolf's Heart Oil and Lover's oil) is burned for 30 minutes daily for seven days during the planetary hour of Venus. A 50/50 blend of Crucible of Courage and Love Me incense is burned concurrently to prompt a proposal.

Recognizes infidelity as a 'crossed' condition. The ritual setup includes white candles (ONE, with Uncrossing oil), red figure candles for the practitioner (TWO, with Dove's Blood or Heart Oil) and the adulterer (THREE, with UNFAITHFUL or BLACK DEVIL oil). A blue candle (FOUR, with PEACEFUL MOME oil) is for communication and protection, and a yellow candle (FIVE, with JOY oil) for calming. STAY AT HOME POWDER is sprinkled into the adulterer's candle flame, shoes, pockets, and bed sheets. Various incenses (Fiery Command, Ten Commandments, High Conquering, Uncrossing, Commanding) are suggested. An additional 'mayonnaise jar' ritual using personal effluvia and hostile ingredients (mustard, peppers, urine, vinegar, sulfur, excrement, rat poison) with wax images for separation is provided.

Reinforces that attraction rituals are for drawing desired outcomes (money, sex, love). Emphasizes performing an Uncrossing ritual beforehand if there are underlying problems. Lodestones (Green/Gold for money, Red for love) are key tools, used on altars, in charm bags, and 'fed' with iron filings. Uncrossing baths are crucial before serious love attraction rituals, and visualization as a 'giant magnet' is vital during practice.
Cautions against irresponsible sex magick, specifically criticizing Aleister Crowley's teachings. Advocates for balanced power and proper research into 'True Tantric-way' practices.

Provides a detailed list of potent herbs and roots: Adam & Eve root, Lucky Hand Root, and Orris Root for love; Frankincense, Camomile, Allspice, Vanilla, Tonka beans, and Squill for money/success. Discusses anointing roots, using live flowers (Bachelor's buttons, Roses, Apple Blossoms), and incorporating herbs into food for prolonged effects. Lists specific love oils (Jasmine, Rose, Musk, Civet, Ambergris) and their uses.

Recommends 8-12 inch taper candles for main rituals due to ease of carving and anointing, and their visual impact. Discusses the impracticality of Seven Day candles in glass and advocates for Votive candles for their ease of charging, carving, and relighting. Stresses the importance of correct candle color over size. Suggests varying candle sizes to direct more energy to specific aspects of a ritual.

Introduces a general Astral Ritual to harmonize a person's astral/astrological energies for overall life improvement. This requires knowing the person's exact astrological sign. The setup includes white candles (ONE, with Zodiac oil), a master candle (TWO, white, with Astral/Astrological oil), and three additional candles (THREE, FOUR, FIVE) whose colors represent specific problems (e.g., green for money, red for love). Incense corresponding to the planetary ruler of the person's sign is burned.

key_concepts.definition: The principle that magick does not create something from nothing, but rather amplifies existing energies, provides opportunities, and enhances current efforts in the practitioner's life.

The crucial state of equilibrium that a practitioner must maintain in their life. Unbalanced success, particularly in love and money, can attract negative forces or ego-driven pitfalls, leading to long-term problems.

A category of rituals designed to attract or pull desired outcomes (e.g., love, money, opportunities) towards the practitioner. These rituals often share similar structural elements but differ in specific tools and correspondences.

Operative magical workings aimed at repelling negative forces, energies, or influences, and safeguarding oneself, relationships, or assets. They are presented as a form of 'insurance' to prevent problems before they arise.

A dynamic magical technique where candles, often figure candles representing individuals or goals, are physically moved closer together over the course of a ritual to symbolize attraction or union, or moved farther apart for separation or banishing. This physical action reinforces the magical intent in the practitioner's subconscious.

Natural magnetic stones used extensively in attraction rituals. They are 'fed' with iron filings to symbolize drawing desired things (money, love) towards the practitioner, and are incorporated into altars, charm bags, and baths.

Specific hourly divisions of the day, each governed by a planet, used to align ritual timing with appropriate celestial influences to enhance their efficacy (e.g., Venus for love, Jupiter for money, Mars for sex/domination).

A potential drawback in powerful drawing rituals for money or sex. While they may bring the desired outcome, there is no guarantee of the source or quality of what is attracted, potentially leading to undesirable or problematic results.

Specific rituals performed to remove or neutralize negative, hexed, or 'crossed' conditions that may be hindering a practitioner's success or attracting problems. They are often recommended as a preparatory step for attraction rituals.

A core meditative technique, particularly vital for attraction rituals, where the practitioner mentally pictures themselves as a powerful magnet actively drawing desired outcomes (money, lovers, success) towards them.

practical_system.description: The practical system presented is a highly operative and prescriptive form of folk magic, deeply rooted in sympathetic correspondences and energetic manipulation. It primarily utilizes candle magic, augmented by specific oils, herbs, powders, and incenses, to attract or repel desired outcomes. A core philosophical tenet is that magic 'enhances' rather than creates, necessitating concurrent mundane effort and clear intent. Rituals often involve a basic altar setup with two flanking white candles and a central 'master' candle, whose color and anointing oils are customized to the ritual's goal. Sympathetic actions, such as moving candles closer for attraction or apart for separation, are integral. The system also stresses the importance of visualization, planetary hours, and the use of 'magnetic' tools like lodestones. Protection and uncrossing rituals are vital components, emphasizing ongoing maintenance and clearing negative influences.

relevant_quotes.text: Magick ENHANCES your life, it will not create something out of nothing.
Balance, everything in life is balance.
When doing a ritual your goal MUST be clear, so define exactly what you are looking for.
The main thing that changes is the color candle in position TWO. IF a RED candle was used, you would have a Love Ritual, etc.
Protection rituals are NOT domination rituals. The aim of this ritual is not to control, but to keep negative forces/energies away.
The more you succeed in life, the more people will be attacking you.

Romance and Love are VERY tricky areas of ritual practice. As stated before, it is the hardest area to get results on a general basis, and as with ALL rituals if you are an obnoxious person, the ritual will soon fade.
The principle of non-selectivity is a problem with Money Drawing as with sex drawing rituals. They will come in, but there is no guaranteeing from where.

Movement of candles can be very helpful in your ritual practices. You are physically doing what you want to be done. This makes your brain fully aspect the 'reality' of the ritual. Your brain sees it as done, being done it makes it happen in reality.
DO NOT GET CAUGHT IN THEIR TRAP. Read Crowley for general information purposes, but use little of what he tells you, that is if you can even find anything practical

One of the most important parts of any magickal ritual, is your ability to properly visualize. This is even more important with Attraction rituals. Picturing yourself as a giant magnet, is most important in a successful ritual.
The only thing you never want to work positive magick is, during the DARK OF THE MOON. This can totally distort your magickal ritual.

critical_analysis.relevance: This text offers a practical and grounded approach to operative folk magic, addressing common human desires for love, money, and protection. It stands out by integrating the necessity of mundane effort and personal responsibility with magical practice, moving beyond a simplistic 'spell-and-forget' mentality. The warnings about 'non-selectivity' in attraction magic and the importance of 'balance' resonate with principles found in many ethical magical traditions, acknowledging the potential complexities and consequences of magical work. Its focus on detailed ritual mechanics, sympathetic correspondences, and a range of magical tools makes it highly relevant for practitioners seeking actionable methods for life improvement.
critical_analysis.target_audience: The primary target audience consists of beginner to intermediate practitioners of folk magic, Hoodoo, or other operative magical systems. The direct, instructional tone and clear step-by-step ritual descriptions cater to those who are ready to engage in hands-on magical work. Individuals interested in candle magic, herbal magic, and sympathetic magical principles will find it particularly useful. The text assumes a basic familiarity with occult concepts (e.g., altars, oils) but defines and contextualizes key elements, making it accessible to those building their foundational practice. The emphasis on ethical considerations, self-improvement, and long-term magical discipline also suggests an audience seeking sustainable and responsible magical development.
